results.title: Robots: the animated docu-soap
results.brief_description:
Just another day in the life of three ordinary robots suffering for their art - Jackson, a painter/sculptor; Roland, a composer/musician; and Hands, a champion skater. This award-winning animated film tracks the demise of the three redundant robots as they attempt to reassert meaning into their empty lives. Made in the style of a documentary-soap and containing a rather dark sense of humour, this is a somewhat offbeat satirical depiction of the genre.
Voice: David Hopewell. (Awards: Best New British Animation, Edinburgh International Film Festival 2000; Jury Award, Art Film Festival 2001)

results.title: Robots: computers at work (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Before we consider the impact of robots on our lives, we need to know more about how they work, what they can do, and how scientists and engineers see them developing in the future. This film takes its examples mainly from Japan where more robots are currently in use than in any other country, including U.S.A.

results.title: Robots: computers at work
results.brief_description: In industry robots have taken over work which is dull, dirty, or dangerous. But there are many other applications such as nursing, helping the blind, fighting fires and crime prevention. Before we consider the impact of robots on our lives, we need to know more about how they work, what they can do, and how scientists and engineers see them developing in the future. This film takes its examples mainly from Japan where more robots are currently in use than in any other country.

results.title: Robots for Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
A brief look at the work being carried out by the CSIRO in programming computers to carry out functions in the manufacturing industries. Also raises issues regarding the changing face of the worplace. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Robinson Charley: the story of our island from 1690-1960
results.creator_credit: Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films, John Halas and Joy Batchelor
results.brief_description: One of a series of animated cartoons about the man-in-the-street character “Charley” created to present information about Government legislation on various subjects to the publc. “Robinson Charley” sketches the economic history of Britain from 1690-1960. “Charley” builds up wealth through trade with other lands until he is hard hit by two wars and has to roll up his sleeves to restore his position.

results.title: Robert Mapplethorpe
results.brief_description: Mapplethorpe’s studies of nude black men were a shameless affirmation of gay sexuality. He has been credited with helping to formulate a sense of gay identity in New York, but as one of the most successful photographers of modern time, his work has also been instrumental in restoring the male nude to mainstream art. This program charts Mapplethorpe’s career from student to leading figure in the art world.

results.title: Robert Klippel: metal construction, 1960
results.creator_credit: Firebird Films, Arthur Cantrill and Corinne Cantrill
results.brief_description: A complex sculpture by Robert Klippel constructed of steel rods and copper plates, accompanied by electrically manipulated vocal sounds and percussive effects. Music: Larry Sitsky.

results.title: Robert Klippel. 4. Junk sculpture, 1963
results.creator_credit: Firebird Films, Arthur Cantrill and Corinne Cantrill
results.brief_description: A sculpture by Robert Klippel incorporating parts of discarded machinery with forms cut from sheet metal accompanied by music written for strings and percussion. Music: Larry Sitsky.

results.title: Robert Klippel. 1. Junk sculpture, 1963
results.creator_credit: Firebird Films, Arthur Cantrill and Corinne Cantrill
results.brief_description: A sculpture by Robert Klippel incorporating parts of discarded machinery with forms cut from sheet metal. The film is cut to a dodecaphonic composition for piano. Music: Larry Sitsky.
